intro: Hieracium aurantiacum, commonly known as the orange hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Hieracium aurantiacum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
